resources.string: Google Chat DMA Bridge
This is a demonstration of bridging Google Chat to Matrix through a client-side app. Please use a test account to avoid data loss/corruption.

"To get started, you'll need to authenticate with Google Chat. Click the button below to send the login URL to yourself and open it on a desktop computer. 

Once open, log in normally and wait until you get to a loading screen. Press F12 on that screen to get to developer tools then visit the Application or Storage tab. 

Expand "Cookies" and select "https://accounts.google.com", find the "oauth_code" row and double click on the value. 

Copy the value here and press "Continue". "

Awesome! Those credentials look good. Now we\'re going to set up your homeserver connection.

Currently you need to set up your own homeserver for this demo, however in a proper build this would happen transparently elsewhere.

Some servers, like Synapse, are relatively easy to set up if you haven't set one up before. You will need a domain name to use.

Once your homeserver is running, click the button below to download the appservice registration file, then install it on your homeserver. 

The account it creates is dedicated to this bridge, and will be the same for all the other bridges you set up as part of this demo series.
Download Appservice File
Test Connection
Enter your homeserver URL and test to ensure everything is set up.

After you've installed the appservice registration file on your homeserver, enter your public homeserver URL (client-server API) and tap "test connection".

This will create a demo user on your homeserver for your rooms to reside. If successful, all of your Google Chat DMs and Spaces will be bridged to that account too.

Matrix rooms created on the account will also be bridged back as Spaces in Google Chat.

Normally, this account registration and picking functionality would happen via some other method. Ideally, other users of this bridging app would be able to find already-bridged chats to join (for example, if your friends were bridged then it'd be ideal to all be using the same Matrix room).
